title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at HCA Florida Memorial Hospital​
Interview Descriptions: You sat down with the manager of the unit and they were very cordial. They work with you to find a date and time to interview and identify the things you're seeking from this job and what you hope to achieve at their hospital.
Interview Questions: What drew you to applying to this hospital? What do you hope to achieve from this position? What is one strength and weakness that you have?

title: Mental Health Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at HCA Florida Memorial Hospital​ in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Great friendly interview process, the supervisor was down to earth and gave me a lot of information about the job. Questions were pretty regular, such as what are your go to interventions, etc.
Interview Questions:
What are your go to interventions?
When was a time you went above and beyond at the job?

title: Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at HCA Florida Memorial Hospital​ (Jacksonville, FL) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Friendly staff. They make you feel welcomed. The process didn’t feel as stressful because it was like I was having a conversation with the staff versus Sitting in front of a review board.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for memorial

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at HCA Florida Memorial Hospital​ (Jacksonville, FL) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was normal interview process where I was interviewed in person. Two individuals interviewed me in which it did not take long. The questions fairly generic, and you could do very well if you study beforehand for a little.
Interview Questions: How does your work ethic differ from others?

title: Registrar ER Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at HCA Florida Memorial Hospital​ (Jacksonville, FL) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and was contacted to schedule a phone interview via email. After completing the phone interview I received a call a week later to schedule a face-to-face interview. The interview lasted approximately 45 minutes and was asked two pages of behavioral interview questions from a Team Lead and a Trainer. I was told the director was out of town and that they would be making job offers the next week (during Hurricane Florence-so I expected it to take a little longer). 

I felt the interview went really well and was told they were going to be hiring at least 12 people. I emphasized that the job was something I really wanted and prepared for it accordingly. I had been hired under a contract position that was to be starting the following week so I decided to cancel the contract before I started it as to not wasted anyone's time. I am now unemployed and really hoping that HR just takes awhile to make their decisions.
Interview Questions: Why should we chose you over another candidate?

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at HCA Florida Memorial Hospital​ (Jacksonville, FL) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Easy to connect with the hiring manager. Questions were basic and not over the top. Expectations were managed prior to walking in. An overall great experience. If I had to recommend this to a friend, I would most definitely suggest them.
Interview Questions: What is one thing you would improve about yourself?

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at HCA Florida Memorial Hospital​ (Houston, TX) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly standard. First interview was a phone screen with a recruiter, the second interview  was a phone screen with a manager and the third interview was an in-person interview with the manager.  The people were nice and the dialog was good.  The reason for the negative experience rating is due to the length of time between the interviews.  The overall process was 3 months from first interview to getting the final answer on the position.   They selected an internal candidate and took 3 1/2 weeks from the in-person interview to reaching out with the decision (only after following up)
Interview Questions: Asked technical knowledge of project management and how situations were handled.

title: Patient Sitter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at HCA Florida Memorial Hospital​ (Jacksonville, FL) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: The Interview lasted for about 10-15 minutes. I was interviewed by two ladies and they asked generic questions. One of them also took me on a tour around the hospital. This hospital has 107 beds, but very nice, as well as very nice people. They said that I would hear something back within a week

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at HCA Florida Memorial Hospital​
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through their website. I then received an email to schedule a selected time for a phone interview for the desired position. I then received a confirmation and reminder email for my scheduled phone interview.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a conflict you encountered with a coworker and how did you handle it?

title: Critical Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at HCA Florida Memorial Hospital​ (Jacksonville, FL) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed initially over the phone by a representative from HR and then had an in person interview with the nurse manager of the unit and the director of the unit. A drug screening was performed through HR a few days later and I also had to have a tb skin test done by employee health prior to orientation as well.
Interview Questions:
What are some of your five year goals?

What is your previous experience in this field?

Are you able to work night shift?

What makes you a better choice compared to others that have applied?

title: CVICU Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at HCA Florida Memorial Hospital​ (Jacksonville, FL) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: A bunch of bs telling me how everyone that is currently employed there sucks. I was told my goal was to "get rid of old trash" as far as other nurses. And that I was needed to accomplish this. I interviewed for a staff position and they only gave me a charge position. How ever, I am incompetent in this job so I just review charts and drink coffee all night.

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at HCA Florida Memorial Hospital​
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with a manager I knew from a previous job at another hospital. After the Interview I was told I had the job and to expect HR to contact me to proceed with the hiring process. It has now been over a month both myself and interviewing manager have made multiple attempts to contact HR. At this point I have found alternative work, this HR department is extremely lacking and unprofessional.
Interview Questions: If I could be any animal what would it be and why....

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at HCA Florida Memorial Hospital​
Interview Descriptions: Initial communication was over 4 weeks from the time my application was submitted. My interactions with employees at this facility were unprofessional at best. No return phone calls. Communication was very intermittent.

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at HCA Florida Memorial Hospital​ (Jacksonville, FL) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Lengthy multiple choice personality profile questionnaire. Phone call from HR about a week later to schedule in person interview with Director, which went about an hour and a half, because we got along well & enjoyed a very pleasant conversation.
Interview Questions: What kind of Case Mgt or Utilization Review experience do you have?

title: Patient Advocate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at HCA Florida Memorial Hospital​ (Jacksonville, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Human resources does not return phone calls ever. You have to continuously direct dial multiple times a day in order to get a "live" person on the phone. When you do finally get the opportunity to speak with someone, the standard response is "I don't know the status of your application. We are short staffed and will have to get back with you." They never do. After 9 weeks someone called to schedule an interview. I politely informed them I've found other employment since their process was tragically broken and entirely way to long. People are looking for jobs to begin the application process in a professional amount of time. It was quite insulting. If they treat prospective employees in this manner, I can't imagine how they treat their current employees. Scary.
